intro: Quintinia quatrefagesii, commonly known as the Quatrefages' quintinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Quintinia quatrefagesii is typically found in dry, scrubland habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially threatened species.
